title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic takes pop at old Man Utd teammate Romelu Lukaku over his poor technique
text:
The Swedish legend doesn’t think much of his former teammate’s technique (Picture: Getty)

Zlatan Ibrahimovic has slated former Manchester United teammate Romelu Lukaku over his lack of technique and poor first touch, though is sure he will be a good signing for Inter Milan.

The Swedish legend had a brief spell alongside Lukaku at Old Trafford before leaving to join MLS side LA Galaxy in January 2018, though the Belgian’s time at the club ended just 18 months later.

And now Ibrahimovic has revealed that he offered to help Lukaku improve his touch and technique in the form of a bet, but the 26-year-old declined.

Lukaku swapped United for Inter over the summer and scored on his debut (Picture: Getty)

In an interview with Gazzetta dello Sport, Ibrahimovic explained: ‘I will say this on Romelu: don’t expect good technique from Lukaku.

‘His best strength is sheer power. If only he’d listened to me…

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘At Manchester United, we made a bet: “I’ll give you £50 for every decent first touch you make.”

‘He replied: “What do I win if I get them all right?” I told him nothing, he would simply become a better player.

‘For the record, he never accepted the bet! Perhaps he was afraid of losing…

‘Joking aside, Lukaku has this mad hunger to prove himself to the world and I’m sure he will do well at Inter too.’

Ibrahimovic was recovering from an ACL injury when Lukaku arrived at United (Picture: Getty)

Ibrahimovic spent three seasons at Inter Milan over a decade ago, scoring 57 times in Serie A, and Lukaku will fancy his chances of posting similar figures after scoring in three of his first seven appearances for his new club.

United boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer was keen to offload Lukaku after he made it clear he wanted to leave the club, while Alexis Sanchez followed soon after, though the Red Devils have subsequently been left short up front after Anthony Martial picked up an injury.
